definition: item/component/classifier for events, things, clothes etc
Dreyfus affair 1894-1906, notorious political scandal in France case involving antisemitism and miscarriage of justice
pinyin: De2 lei2 fu2 si1 an4 jian4

sentences.english: There are many cases of human rights violations filed before the police.
sentences.chinese: 警方接手許多人權侵犯案件，往往牽連到高級官員。

sentences.english: An investigation team led by the provincial public security department has been formed.
sentences.chinese: 省公安廳爲此成立的一個案件調查小組。

sentences.english: Even criminal cases are not immune.
sentences.chinese: 甚至犯罪案件也不能倖免。

sentences.english: It is a very simple case of robbery.
sentences.chinese: 這是一個很簡單的搶劫案件。

sentences.english: Recently, he worried about a case of lead poisoning.
sentences.chinese: 最近，他正擔憂着一樁鉛中毒案件。

sentences.english: There was a prima facie case that a contempt of court had been committed.
sentences.chinese: 表面上看這是一宗藐視法庭的案件。

sentences.english: In criminal cases a q. c. may appear alone .
sentences.chinese: 在刑事案件中，王室法律顧問可以單獨出庭。

sentences.english: The court ordered the Japanese side to pay compensation in this case.
sentences.chinese: 在這個案件中，法庭判令日方賠償。

sentences.english: Judicial accounting technology is a specialism means to investigate and prosecute economic crime case.
sentences.chinese: 司法會計技術是查辦經濟犯罪案件的專門手段。

sentences.english: In crime case spot, the shoe imprints is one of most common traces.
sentences.chinese: 在刑事犯罪案件現場，鞋印是最爲常見的痕跡之一。

sentences.english: An off-duty police officer is caught on camera at a bar, mocking a man he watched die.
sentences.chinese: 這名警察在酒吧嘲笑一名他正在調查的案件中的死者。

sentences.english: At last the litigants could easily interfere in cases, which hurts the fairness of justice.
sentences.chinese: 三是案件易受當事人不正當干預，影響司法公正。

sentences.english: Venue - Authority of a court to hear a matter based on geographical location.
sentences.chinese: 法院審理案件的權力依據地理位置所做的劃分。

sentences.english: The plaintiff proposes that this action be tried at Brampton.
sentences.chinese: 原告建議該案件在布蘭普登審理。

sentences.english: Thee essay is well-written with a standard format of legal letters, legal memoranda and briefs.
sentences.chinese: 緹律師信函，法律備忘錄，案件辯論書格式準確。

definition: to investigate (as detective)/to solve (crime)/to uncover (a plot)/to sniff out/to break in and analyze/detective work/to scout
to conclude a case/to wind up
to register (to an official organism)/to file a case (for investigation)
to adjudicate/to finish a trial/to try and pass verdict
to file for investigation/to prosecute (a case)
to uncover (a criminal plot)/to break open and capture
to detain as criminal/criminal detention/abbr. for 刑事拘留[xing2 shi4 ju1 liu2]
